trans-unit.source: Step 4(b): Configure the Response Bridge
trans-unit.target: Step 4(b): Configure the Response Bridge

trans-unit.source: As part of the response bridge of the <token>request_response</token>, the tutorial demonstrates the following tasks:
trans-unit.target: As part of the response bridge of the <token>request_response</token>, the tutorial demonstrates the following tasks:

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Configure the pre-<token>transform</token> Enrich stage</embeddedLabel> – In this stage, define the property that must be extracted and promoted within the response message.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Configure the pre-<token>transform</token> Enrich stage</embeddedLabel> – In this stage, define the property that must be extracted and promoted within the response message.

trans-unit.source: This property is used within the <token>bridge</token> for processing the message, such as assigning values to elements in the response message.
trans-unit.target: This property is used within the <token>bridge</token> for processing the message, such as assigning values to elements in the response message.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Configure the <token>transform</token> stage</embeddedLabel> – In this stage, include the <token>transform</token>s defined in the previous steps to <token>transform</token> the response message from Northwind into ACORD-compliant response schemas.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Configure the <token>transform</token> stage</embeddedLabel> – In this stage, include the <token>transform</token>s defined in the previous steps to <token>transform</token> the response message from Northwind into ACORD-compliant response schemas.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Configure the Reply Action</embeddedLabel> – In this stage, stamp the response message with message headers right before it is sent back to the client that sent the original request message.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Configure the Reply Action</embeddedLabel> – In this stage, stamp the response message with message headers right before it is sent back to the client that sent the original request message.

trans-unit.source: Configure the Pre-<token>transform</token> Enrich Stage
trans-unit.target: Configure the Pre-<token>transform</token> Enrich Stage

trans-unit.source: According to the <link xlink:href="14d7f8b8-074c-485f-a2f6-c9a02cc1779a#BKMK_Scenario" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Business Scenario</link>, the response message that the relay services send to the <token>bridge</token> contains a message header called <embeddedLabel>MsgStatus</embeddedLabel> and its value is set to <embeddedLabel>Success</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: According to the <link xlink:href="14d7f8b8-074c-485f-a2f6-c9a02cc1779a#BKMK_Scenario" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Business Scenario</link>, the response message that the relay services send to the <token>bridge</token> contains a message header called <embeddedLabel>MsgStatus</embeddedLabel> and its value is set to <embeddedLabel>Success</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: The value of the <embeddedLabel>MsgStatus</embeddedLabel> header must be assigned to the <embeddedLabel>MsgStatusCd</embeddedLabel> element in the ACORD-compliant response schema.
trans-unit.target: The value of the <embeddedLabel>MsgStatus</embeddedLabel> header must be assigned to the <embeddedLabel>MsgStatusCd</embeddedLabel> element in the ACORD-compliant response schema.

trans-unit.source: The following two steps must be performed to achieve it.
trans-unit.target: The following two steps must be performed to achieve it.

trans-unit.source: In the <embeddedLabel>Enrich</embeddedLabel> stage, extract the value of the <embeddedLabel>MsgStatus</embeddedLabel> header in the response message and assign it to a property.
trans-unit.target: In the <embeddedLabel>Enrich</embeddedLabel> stage, extract the value of the <embeddedLabel>MsgStatus</embeddedLabel> header in the response message and assign it to a property.

trans-unit.source: Using the <embeddedLabel>Get Context Property</embeddedLabel> <token>mapop</token> in a <token>transform</token>, assign the value from the property to the <embeddedLabel>MsgStatusCd</embeddedLabel> element in the response schema.
trans-unit.target: Using the <embeddedLabel>Get Context Property</embeddedLabel> <token>mapop</token> in a <token>transform</token>, assign the value from the property to the <embeddedLabel>MsgStatusCd</embeddedLabel> element in the response schema.

trans-unit.source: The second task is already completed in the procedures <link xlink:href="1442290a-8fca-42c6-97c4-7e3bb4e55344#BKMK_TransformRes1" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">To map NorthwindSchema.xsd to ACORDRs1.xsd</link> and <link xlink:href="1442290a-8fca-42c6-97c4-7e3bb4e55344#BKMK_TransformRes2" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">To map NorthwindSchema.xsd to ACORDRs2.xsd</link>.
trans-unit.target: The second task is already completed in the procedures <link xlink:href="1442290a-8fca-42c6-97c4-7e3bb4e55344#BKMK_TransformRes1" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">To map NorthwindSchema.xsd to ACORDRs1.xsd</link> and <link xlink:href="1442290a-8fca-42c6-97c4-7e3bb4e55344#BKMK_TransformRes2" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">To map NorthwindSchema.xsd to ACORDRs2.xsd</link>.

trans-unit.source: The following procedure demonstrates how to perform the first task, which is to create a property with the name <embeddedLabel>MsgStatus</embeddedLabel> and set it to extract the value from the <embeddedLabel>MsgStatus</embeddedLabel> response message header.
trans-unit.target: The following procedure demonstrates how to perform the first task, which is to create a property with the name <embeddedLabel>MsgStatus</embeddedLabel> and set it to extract the value from the <embeddedLabel>MsgStatus</embeddedLabel> response message header.

trans-unit.source: To extract and promote properties in the pre-<token>transform</token> Enrich stage
trans-unit.target: To extract and promote properties in the pre-<token>transform</token> Enrich stage

trans-unit.source: In the response bridge of the <token>request_response</token> configuration, select the <embeddedLabel>Enrich</embeddedLabel> activity within the pre-<token>transform</token> <embeddedLabel>Enrich</embeddedLabel> stage, and from the <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel> window, select the ellipsis button <embeddedLabel>(…)</embeddedLabel> against <embeddedLabel>Property Definitions</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: In the response bridge of the <token>request_response</token> configuration, select the <embeddedLabel>Enrich</embeddedLabel> activity within the pre-<token>transform</token> <embeddedLabel>Enrich</embeddedLabel> stage, and from the <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel> window, select the ellipsis button <embeddedLabel>(…)</embeddedLabel> against <embeddedLabel>Property Definitions</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: In <embeddedLabel>Property Definitions</embeddedLabel>, select <embeddedLabel>Add</embeddedLabel> to open the <embeddedLabel>Add Property</embeddedLabel> dialog box.
trans-unit.target: In <embeddedLabel>Property Definitions</embeddedLabel>, select <embeddedLabel>Add</embeddedLabel> to open the <embeddedLabel>Add Property</embeddedLabel> dialog box.

trans-unit.source: In <embeddedLabel>Add Property</embeddedLabel>, do the following:
trans-unit.target: In <embeddedLabel>Add Property</embeddedLabel>, do the following:

trans-unit.source: Section
trans-unit.target: Section

trans-unit.source: Field Name
trans-unit.target: Field Name

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Source (Read From)
trans-unit.target: Source (Read From)

trans-unit.source: Type
trans-unit.target: Type

trans-unit.source: Select <userInput>Soap</userInput> from the drop-down list.
trans-unit.target: Select <userInput>Soap</userInput> from the drop-down list.

trans-unit.source: SOAP Header Namespace
trans-unit.target: SOAP Header Namespace

trans-unit.source: Enter the following namespace:
trans-unit.target: Enter the following namespace:

trans-unit.source: The namespace value is obtained from the relay service code that generates the response message.
trans-unit.target: The namespace value is obtained from the relay service code that generates the response message.

trans-unit.source: Here’s that line of code that sets the message header with the namespace:
trans-unit.target: Here’s that line of code that sets the message header with the namespace:

trans-unit.source: The value provided for the SOAP Header Namespace property is the namespace that the relay service sets on the message while sending the response back.
trans-unit.target: The value provided for the SOAP Header Namespace property is the namespace that the relay service sets on the message while sending the response back.

trans-unit.source: Identifier
trans-unit.target: Identifier

trans-unit.source: Set this property to the name of the header, which is <userInput>MsgStatus</userInput>.
trans-unit.target: Set this property to the name of the header, which is <userInput>MsgStatus</userInput>.

trans-unit.source: Property (Write To)
trans-unit.target: Property (Write To)

trans-unit.source: Property Name
trans-unit.target: Property Name

trans-unit.source: Set the name of the property to <userInput>MsgStatus</userInput>.
trans-unit.target: Set the name of the property to <userInput>MsgStatus</userInput>.

trans-unit.source: So, the value from the <embeddedLabel>MsgStatus</embeddedLabel> header in the response message is passed on to the <embeddedLabel>MsgStatus</embeddedLabel> property.
trans-unit.target: So, the value from the <embeddedLabel>MsgStatus</embeddedLabel> header in the response message is passed on to the <embeddedLabel>MsgStatus</embeddedLabel> property.

trans-unit.source: Data Type
trans-unit.target: Data Type

trans-unit.source: Set the data type to <userInput>string</userInput>.
trans-unit.target: Set the data type to <userInput>string</userInput>.

trans-unit.source: The <embeddedLabel>Add Property</embeddedLabel> dialog box resembles the following:
trans-unit.target: The <embeddedLabel>Add Property</embeddedLabel> dialog box resembles the following:

trans-unit.source: Select <embeddedLabel>OK</embeddedLabel> and then select <embeddedLabel>OK</embeddedLabel> again in the <embeddedLabel>Property Definitions</embeddedLabel> dialog box.
trans-unit.target: Select <embeddedLabel>OK</embeddedLabel> and then select <embeddedLabel>OK</embeddedLabel> again in the <embeddedLabel>Property Definitions</embeddedLabel> dialog box.

trans-unit.source: Save the <token>bridge</token> configuration.
trans-unit.target: Save the <token>bridge</token> configuration.

trans-unit.source: Configure the <token>transform</token> Stage in the Response bridge
trans-unit.target: Configure the <token>transform</token> Stage in the Response bridge

trans-unit.source: The procedures (<link xlink:href="1442290a-8fca-42c6-97c4-7e3bb4e55344#BKMK_TransformRes1" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">To map NorthwindSchema.xsd to ACORDRs1.xsd</link> and <link xlink:href="1442290a-8fca-42c6-97c4-7e3bb4e55344#BKMK_TransformRes2" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">To map NorthwindSchema.xsd to ACORDRs2.xsd</link>) demonstrated how to create two <token>transform</token>s to map the response message from the relay services to the ACORD-compliant response message format.
trans-unit.target: The procedures (<link xlink:href="1442290a-8fca-42c6-97c4-7e3bb4e55344#BKMK_TransformRes1" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">To map NorthwindSchema.xsd to ACORDRs1.xsd</link> and <link xlink:href="1442290a-8fca-42c6-97c4-7e3bb4e55344#BKMK_TransformRes2" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">To map NorthwindSchema.xsd to ACORDRs2.xsd</link>) demonstrated how to create two <token>transform</token>s to map the response message from the relay services to the ACORD-compliant response message format.

trans-unit.source: This step demonstrates how to add those <token>transform</token>s to the response bridge of the <token>bridge</token> configuration so that the <token>bridge</token> uses the <token>transform</token>s to process the response message before sending it back to the client.
trans-unit.target: This step demonstrates how to add those <token>transform</token>s to the response bridge of the <token>bridge</token> configuration so that the <token>bridge</token> uses the <token>transform</token>s to process the response message before sending it back to the client.

trans-unit.source: To enter <token>transform</token>s in a <token>bridge</token>
trans-unit.target: To enter <token>transform</token>s in a <token>bridge</token>

trans-unit.source: In the <token>request_response</token> configuration, select the <embeddedLabel>Xml Transform</embeddedLabel> activity within the <embeddedLabel><token>transform</token></embeddedLabel> stage, and from the <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel> window, select the ellipsis button <embeddedLabel>(…)</embeddedLabel> against the <embeddedLabel>Maps</embeddedLabel> property.
trans-unit.target: In the <token>request_response</token> configuration, select the <embeddedLabel>Xml Transform</embeddedLabel> activity within the <embeddedLabel><token>transform</token></embeddedLabel> stage, and from the <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel> window, select the ellipsis button <embeddedLabel>(…)</embeddedLabel> against the <embeddedLabel>Maps</embeddedLabel> property.

trans-unit.source: The <embeddedLabel>Maps Selection</embeddedLabel> dialog box, by default, shows only those maps that have the destination schema same as the response schema you specified earlier.
trans-unit.target: The <embeddedLabel>Maps Selection</embeddedLabel> dialog box, by default, shows only those maps that have the destination schema same as the response schema you specified earlier.

trans-unit.source: For this tutorial, because the <token>bridge</token> must process and <token>transform</token> the internal Northwind schema to two ACORD-compliant response schemas, select both the <token>transform</token>s you created (one to <token>transform</token> NorthwindSchema.xsd to ACORDRs1.xsd and the other to <token>transform</token> NorthwindSchema.xsd to ACORDRs2.xsd).
trans-unit.target: For this tutorial, because the <token>bridge</token> must process and <token>transform</token> the internal Northwind schema to two ACORD-compliant response schemas, select both the <token>transform</token>s you created (one to <token>transform</token> NorthwindSchema.xsd to ACORDRs1.xsd and the other to <token>transform</token> NorthwindSchema.xsd to ACORDRs2.xsd).

trans-unit.source: In <embeddedLabel>Maps Selection</embeddedLabel>, select <embeddedLabel>OK</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: In <embeddedLabel>Maps Selection</embeddedLabel>, select <embeddedLabel>OK</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: The maps you added are listed under the <embeddedLabel>Selected Maps</embeddedLabel> box on the itinerary designer.
trans-unit.target: The maps you added are listed under the <embeddedLabel>Selected Maps</embeddedLabel> box on the itinerary designer.

trans-unit.source: Save the <token>bridge</token> configuration.
trans-unit.target: Save the <token>bridge</token> configuration.

trans-unit.source: Configure the Reply Action
trans-unit.target: Configure the Reply Action

trans-unit.source: According to the <link xlink:href="14d7f8b8-074c-485f-a2f6-c9a02cc1779a#BKMK_Scenario" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Business Scenario</link>, the response message sent back to the client must include a message header called <embeddedLabel>ProcessingStatus</embeddedLabel> and its value must be set to <embeddedLabel>Complete</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: According to the <link xlink:href="14d7f8b8-074c-485f-a2f6-c9a02cc1779a#BKMK_Scenario" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Business Scenario</link>, the response message sent back to the client must include a message header called <embeddedLabel>ProcessingStatus</embeddedLabel> and its value must be set to <embeddedLabel>Complete</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: To achieve this through the <token>bridge</token>, use the <embeddedLabel>Reply Action</embeddedLabel> ‘stage’ in the <token>bridge</token> configuration.
trans-unit.target: To achieve this through the <token>bridge</token>, use the <embeddedLabel>Reply Action</embeddedLabel> ‘stage’ in the <token>bridge</token> configuration.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Reply Action</embeddedLabel> adds headers to the message, before it finally exits the <token>bridge</token>.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Reply Action</embeddedLabel> adds headers to the message, before it finally exits the <token>bridge</token>.

trans-unit.source: These headers can either have a constant value or values from the properties that are already promoted in the <embeddedLabel>Enrich</embeddedLabel> stages.
trans-unit.target: These headers can either have a constant value or values from the properties that are already promoted in the <embeddedLabel>Enrich</embeddedLabel> stages.

trans-unit.source: Because the value of the header must always be set to <embeddedLabel>Complete</embeddedLabel>, this section uses the option to enter a constant value for a message header.
trans-unit.target: Because the value of the header must always be set to <embeddedLabel>Complete</embeddedLabel>, this section uses the option to enter a constant value for a message header.

trans-unit.source: To configure the reply action
trans-unit.target: To configure the reply action

trans-unit.source: In the response bridge of the <token>request_response</token> configuration, select the <embeddedLabel>Reply Action</embeddedLabel> activity within the <embeddedLabel>Send Reply</embeddedLabel> box.
trans-unit.target: In the response bridge of the <token>request_response</token> configuration, select the <embeddedLabel>Reply Action</embeddedLabel> activity within the <embeddedLabel>Send Reply</embeddedLabel> box.

trans-unit.source: From the <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel> pane, select the ellipsis button <embeddedLabel>(…)</embeddedLabel> against the <embeddedLabel>Reply Action</embeddedLabel> property to open the <embeddedLabel>Reply Actions</embeddedLabel> dialog box.
trans-unit.target: From the <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel> pane, select the ellipsis button <embeddedLabel>(…)</embeddedLabel> against the <embeddedLabel>Reply Action</embeddedLabel> property to open the <embeddedLabel>Reply Actions</embeddedLabel> dialog box.

trans-unit.source: In <embeddedLabel>Reply Actions</embeddedLabel>, select <embeddedLabel>Add</embeddedLabel> to open the <embeddedLabel>Add Reply Action</embeddedLabel> dialog box.
trans-unit.target: In <embeddedLabel>Reply Actions</embeddedLabel>, select <embeddedLabel>Add</embeddedLabel> to open the <embeddedLabel>Add Reply Action</embeddedLabel> dialog box.

trans-unit.source: In <embeddedLabel>Add Reply Action</embeddedLabel>, do the following:
trans-unit.target: In <embeddedLabel>Add Reply Action</embeddedLabel>, do the following:

trans-unit.source: Section
trans-unit.target: Section

trans-unit.source: Field Name
trans-unit.target: Field Name

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Property (Read From)
trans-unit.target: Property (Read From)

trans-unit.source: Expression
trans-unit.target: Expression

trans-unit.source: Enter the expression as <userInput>'Complete'</userInput>.
trans-unit.target: Enter the expression as <userInput>'Complete'</userInput>.

trans-unit.source: Always enter the value for an expression within single quotes.
trans-unit.target: Always enter the value for an expression within single quotes.

trans-unit.source: Destination (Write To)
trans-unit.target: Destination (Write To)

trans-unit.source: Type
trans-unit.target: Type

trans-unit.source: Enter the message type as <userInput>SOAP</userInput>.
trans-unit.target: Enter the message type as <userInput>SOAP</userInput>.

trans-unit.source: SOAP Header Namespace
trans-unit.target: SOAP Header Namespace

trans-unit.source: Enter the namespace of the custom SOAP header to which the value is assigned.
trans-unit.target: Enter the namespace of the custom SOAP header to which the value is assigned.

trans-unit.source: For this tutorial, set the namespace to <codeInline>http://Northwind.com/insurance/ACORD1/xml/</codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: For this tutorial, set the namespace to <codeInline>http://Northwind.com/insurance/ACORD1/xml/</codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: This field is disabled if you select a standard header name from the <embeddedLabel>Identifier</embeddedLabel> drop-down list.
trans-unit.target: This field is disabled if you select a standard header name from the <embeddedLabel>Identifier</embeddedLabel> drop-down list.

trans-unit.source: Identifier
trans-unit.target: Identifier

trans-unit.source: Specifies the name of message header property to which the value is assigned.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the name of message header property to which the value is assigned.

trans-unit.source: According the business scenario, set this property to <userInput>ProcessingStatus</userInput>.
trans-unit.target: According the business scenario, set this property to <userInput>ProcessingStatus</userInput>.

trans-unit.source: Select <embeddedLabel>OK</embeddedLabel> and then select <embeddedLabel>OK</embeddedLabel> again in the <embeddedLabel>Reply Actions</embeddedLabel> dialog box.
trans-unit.target: Select <embeddedLabel>OK</embeddedLabel> and then select <embeddedLabel>OK</embeddedLabel> again in the <embeddedLabel>Reply Actions</embeddedLabel> dialog box.

trans-unit.source: Save the <token>bridge</token> configuration.
trans-unit.target: Save the <token>bridge</token> configuration.
